Item2: Blazor WebAssembly (WASM) apps run client-side in the browser on a WebAssembly-based .NET runtime.
Blazor WebAssembly supports ahead-of-time (AOT) compilation, where you can compile your .NET code directly into WebAssembly.
The Blazor WebAssembly template creates the initial files and directory structure for a Blazor WebAssembly app.
Blazor apps are based on Razor components, which are a self-contained portion of user interface (UI) with processing logic to enable dynamic behavior.
Blazor apps can invoke JavaScript (JS) functions from .NET methods and .NET methods from JS functions.
